statistics.title: Statistics
statistics.description: is a task prioritization tool developed by the 34th President of the United States, Dwight Eisenhower. It helps organize tasks by importance and urgency.
statistics.urgentImportantDesc: Crises, urgent problems, deadlines. Do immediately.
statistics.importantNotUrgentDesc: Planning, development, relationships. Schedule time for completion.
statistics.urgentNotImportantDesc: Distractions, some calls, meetings. Delegate or minimize.
statistics.notUrgentNotImportantDesc: Time wasters, distracting factors. Delete or postpone.
statistics.usageTipText: Try to spend more time in the "Important, but not Urgent" quadrant. This will help prevent tasks from appearing in the "Important and Urgent" quadrant.

seo.title: Eisenhower Matrix - Task Management and Priorities
seo.subtitle: Effective task planning
seo.description: The Eisenhower Matrix is a time management tool that helps divide tasks into four categories by importance and urgency: important and urgent, important but not urgent, urgent but not important, not important and not urgent.
seo.benefits: Benefits of using the Eisenhower Matrix
seo.howToUse: How to use the Eisenhower Matrix
seo.step2: Determine the importance of each task
seo.step3: Determine the urgency of each task
seo.step5: Start with tasks from the first quadrant
seo.quadrant1Desc: Crises, urgent problems, tasks with deadlines.
seo.quadrant4: Quadrant 4: Not important and not urgent
seo.keywordsList: eisenhower matrix, task management, planning, priorities, productivity, time management, task planner, important tasks, urgent tasks, efficiency, time organization, time management, planner, task organizer, priority system, priority matrix, eisenhower quadrants, eisenhower method, productivity tools
seo.author: Eisenhower Matrix

faq1.question: What is the Eisenhower Matrix?
faq1.answer: The Eisenhower Matrix is a time management tool that helps divide tasks into four categories by importance and urgency.

faq2.question: How to use the Eisenhower Matrix?
faq2.answer: Write down all tasks, determine their importance and urgency, place them in appropriate quadrants, and start with important and urgent tasks.

faq3.question: What benefits does the Eisenhower Matrix provide?
faq3.answer: Increased productivity, effective time management, proper priority setting, reduced stress, and improved decision quality.

about.title: About
about.description: Free online task planner based on the Eisenhower Matrix for effective priority management.

section1.title: 1. General Provisions
section1.content: This Privacy Policy defines the procedure for processing and protecting personal data of users of the website todolist.su (hereinafter referred to as the Site).
section1.content2: By using the Site, you agree to the terms of this Privacy Policy.

section2.title: 2. Data Collected
section2.item2: Tasks created by the user (stored locally in the browser)
section2.item3: Technical data (IP address, browser type, operating system)

section3.title: 3. Use of Data
section3.content: The collected data is used exclusively for:
section3.content2: Ensuring the functionality of the service, improving user experience, and analyzing Site usage. We do not share your data with third parties without your consent.

section4.title: 4. Cookies
section4.content: The Site uses cookies to identify users and save their tasks. You can disable cookies in your browser settings, but this may affect the Site's functionality.
section4.content2: We also use analytics services (Yandex.Metrika, Google Analytics) to collect visit statistics.

section5.title: 5. Data Security
section5.content: We take measures to protect your data from unauthorized access, modification, disclosure, or destruction.

section6.title: 6. Contacts
section6.content: For questions related to the processing of personal data, you can contact us through the "Contact" section.

section1.content: By using the todolist.su website, you agree to the terms of this Terms of Service.
section1.content2: If you do not agree with any of the terms, please do not use the Site.

section2.title: 2. Use of Service
section2.item1: Use the Site only for lawful purposes
section2.item2: Not violate the rights of other users
section2.item3: Not attempt to gain unauthorized access to the system

section3.content2: You may use the Site for personal purposes, but may not copy, distribute, or use Site materials for commercial purposes without written permission.

section4.title: 4. Limitation of Liability
section4.content: The Site is provided "as is" without any warranties. We are not responsible for any losses arising from the use or inability to use the Site.
section4.content2: We reserve the right to modify, suspend, or discontinue the Site at any time without prior notice.

section5.title: 5. Changes to Agreement
section5.content: We reserve the right to modify this Terms of Service at any time. Changes take effect from the moment they are published on the Site.

section1.title: 1. What are Cookies
section1.content: Cookies are small text files that are saved on your device when you visit a website.
section1.content2: The todolist.su website uses cookies to ensure functionality and improve user experience.

section2.title: 2. Types of Cookies Used
section2.content: We use the following types of cookies:
section2.item1: Necessary cookies — for user identification and task saving
section2.item2: Analytics cookies — for collecting visit statistics (Yandex.Metrika, Google Analytics)
section2.item3: Advertising cookies — for showing relevant ads (Google AdSense, Yandex.Direct)

section3.title: 3. Cookie Management
section3.content: You can manage cookies through your browser settings. However, disabling cookies may affect the Site's functionality.
section3.content2: To manage advertising cookies, you can use the settings of Google and Yandex advertising networks.

section4.title: 4. Third-Party Services
section4.content: The Site uses third-party services that may set their own cookies:
section4.content2: Yandex.Metrika, Google Analytics, Google AdSense, Yandex.Direct. The use of these services is governed by their own privacy policies.

section1.title: About the Project
section1.content: Eisenhower Matrix is a free online tool for task and priority management, based on the famous method of the 34th President of the United States, Dwight Eisenhower.
section1.content2: Our service helps effectively organize tasks by dividing them into four quadrants by importance and urgency.

section2.title: Our Features
section2.item1: Creating and managing tasks with drag & drop
section2.item2: Filtering and sorting tasks by priority and status
section2.item5: Multilingual support (Russian, English, German, Spanish, Chinese)

section3.title: Security and Privacy
section3.content: We value your privacy. All data is stored locally in your browser using cookies for identification.
section3.content2: Your tasks are visible only to you. We do not share your data with third parties without your consent.

section4.title: Contacts
section4.content: If you have questions, suggestions, or feedback, please contact us through the "Contact" section.

section1.title: Get in Touch
section1.content: We are always happy to receive your feedback, suggestions, and questions about the service.
section1.content2: Use the form below to contact the project author.

section3.title: Response Time
section3.content: We try to respond to all messages within 24-48 hours.

seoContent.title: Eisenhower Matrix Guide: How to Effectively Manage Tasks

howTo.title: How to Use the Eisenhower Matrix for Task Management

section1.title: How to Properly Apply the Eisenhower Priority Matrix
section1.content: The Eisenhower Matrix is a powerful time management tool for increasing productivity and effectively managing tasks. Learn to use this planning method to organize your workflow and achieve goals.
section1.step1: Make a complete list of all your tasks and matters that require attention. Use a task planner or organizer to systematize.
section1.step2: Determine the importance of each task: important tasks affect the achievement of your long-term goals, career development, or personal growth.
section1.step3: Assess urgency: urgent tasks have clear deadlines or require immediate execution.
section1.step4: Distribute tasks across the four quadrants of the priority matrix: important and urgent, important but not urgent, urgent but not important, not important and not urgent.
section1.step5: Start execution with the first quadrant (important and urgent), then move to the second quadrant for strategic planning.

section2.title: How to Increase Productivity with the Priority System
section2.content: Effective time management begins with proper prioritization. The Eisenhower Matrix helps organize tasks and improve time management.
section2.item1: Use an online task planner to visualize the priority matrix and track task execution progress.
section2.item2: Regularly review and update the task list, moving them between quadrants as importance and urgency change.
section2.item3: Focus on tasks from the second quadrant (important, but not urgent) to prevent crisis situations and improve work quality.
section2.item4: Delegate or minimize tasks from the third quadrant to free up time for truly important matters.

section3.title: How to Organize Tasks Using the Eisenhower Method
section3.content: Organizing tasks according to the Eisenhower Matrix allows you to effectively manage work time and increase personal efficiency. This productivity tool helps make the right decisions about how to spend time.
section3.content2: By applying task prioritization techniques, you can better control your workflow, reduce stress from overload, and achieve set goals faster.

section4.title: How to Use a Task Planner for Priority Management
section4.content: Modern task planning tools make it easy to apply the Eisenhower Matrix in daily work. Use our free planner for effective task management.
section4.item1: Create tasks and automatically distribute them across matrix quadrants based on importance and urgency.
section4.item2: Use filters and sorting for quick access to tasks of a certain priority or execution status.
section4.item3: Track statistics on task distribution by quadrants to analyze the effectiveness of your time management.
section4.item4: Export data to CSV for further analysis and planning in other tools.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions About the Eisenhower Matrix
faq.question1: What is the Eisenhower Matrix and how does it help in task management?
faq.answer1: The Eisenhower Matrix is a time management tool developed by the 34th President of the United States, Dwight Eisenhower. It helps divide tasks into four categories by importance and urgency, allowing you to effectively manage priorities and increase productivity.
faq.question2: How to correctly determine the importance and urgency of a task?
faq.answer2: Important tasks affect the achievement of your long-term goals, career development, or personal growth. Urgent tasks have clear deadlines or require immediate execution. Use a task planner to systematize and visualize priorities.
faq.question3: What tasks belong to the 'Important and Urgent' quadrant?
faq.answer3: The first quadrant includes crisis situations, urgent problems, tasks with deadlines, and urgent matters that require immediate attention. These are tasks that cannot be postponed and are critically important for achieving goals.
faq.question4: How to use the priority matrix to increase productivity?
faq.answer4: Regularly use the Eisenhower Matrix to organize tasks, focus on the second quadrant (important, but not urgent) to prevent crises, delegate tasks from the third quadrant, and minimize time on the fourth quadrant. Use an online planner to track progress.
faq.question5: Can the Eisenhower Matrix be used in a team?
faq.answer5: Yes, the priority matrix is excellent for teamwork. It helps the team coordinate priorities, distribute tasks, and improve communication. Use a collaborative task planner to coordinate team work.
faq.question6: How often should tasks in the matrix be reviewed?
faq.answer6: It is recommended to review and update the priority matrix daily or weekly. Tasks can change their importance and urgency over time, so regular review helps maintain plan relevance and task management efficiency.
faq.question7: What is the difference between importance and urgency of a task?
faq.answer7: Task importance is determined by its impact on achieving long-term goals and results. Urgency is related to time constraints and deadlines. Important tasks require attention regardless of urgency, and urgent tasks require quick response.
faq.question8: How does the Eisenhower Matrix help reduce stress from task overload?
faq.answer8: The priority matrix helps visualize all tasks, clearly determine what is truly important, and organize work to prevent the accumulation of urgent tasks. This reduces stress and improves the quality of decisions made.
faq.question9: What tools are best to use for applying the Eisenhower Matrix?
faq.answer9: You can use our free online task planner, specifically designed to work with the Eisenhower Matrix. Any task organizers that allow visual separation of tasks by priority quadrants are also suitable.
faq.question10: How to delegate tasks from the 'Urgent but Not Important' quadrant?
faq.answer10: Tasks from the third quadrant can often be delegated to other team members or automated. Determine who can perform the task more effectively, transfer authority, and set clear expectations for results and deadlines.
faq.question11: Why is it important to focus on the 'Important but Not Urgent' quadrant?
faq.answer11: The second quadrant contains strategic planning, development, and problem prevention tasks. Focusing on this quadrant helps prevent tasks from appearing in the first quadrant (crises), which significantly increases efficiency and reduces stress.
faq.question12: How to export data from the Eisenhower Matrix?
faq.answer12: Our task planner allows you to export all tasks to CSV format. This is convenient for analysis in Excel, report creation, or data backup. Use the export function in the planner menu.
faq.question13: Can the Eisenhower Matrix be used for personal goals, not just work?
faq.answer13: Absolutely! The priority matrix is universal and excellent for managing both work and personal tasks. It helps balance different areas of life and make the right decisions about how to spend time.
faq.question14: How to start using the Eisenhower Matrix from scratch?
faq.answer14: Start by making a complete list of all your tasks. Then evaluate each task by importance and urgency, distribute them into quadrants, and start execution with the first quadrant. Use our free planner for visualization and progress tracking.
faq.question15: What mistakes are most often made when using the Eisenhower Matrix?
faq.answer15: Common mistakes: overestimating task urgency, ignoring the second quadrant, lack of regular priority review, and trying to complete all tasks alone without delegation. Avoid these mistakes for maximum efficiency.
